Very cool and I Love Burritos!

Yes it is, you can find it on spaceport by searching for jumpgate. However it is for an older version of the game and the files need to be edited to get them working on the actual version.
When Kerbals won't stick to their snack rations, you have to discipline them.
Here's my DC-10. The building/testing sequence involved way too many crashes, but here it is.

When Kerbals won't stick to their snack rations, you have to discipline them.

http://i.imgur.com/F7U0Edk.png

It puts the lotion on the skin, or it gets the hose again.

Here's my DC-10. The building/testing sequence involved way too many crashes, but here it is.

Well, there it is on your computer, at least. We can't see it from here friend, you'll need to upload the picture somewhere where the rest of us can see it, like imgur.com.
Hump Day
So we heard you like Japanese planes, Any guesses on what this is?

The following happens after a mishap on the first successful mÃƒÂ¼nar lander. i didnt knew how to take screenshots yet and just so happens that a crew of 3 Kerbals landed a little bit too fast, and their engine was crushed, while the rest of the vessel remained intact 3 kerbals, alone on the mÃƒÂ¼n.

The following album documents the events that unfolded afterwards

After several failed rescue attemps the engineers decided to scrap the whole return idea so it was decided to bring civilization to them (Notice these are my first steps within the game and without mods). A base was built and only one kerbal died due to being too close to a landing hangar.

so that gets us two kerbals alone on the mÃƒÂ¼n on this empty base.

The first base lagged pretty bad, so a second one was built with a beacon and the monsterlab, while the first one got demolished and only the rovers were left.

we just had to bring the old crew to it. therefore a space station was built (old Midway), a new space errand ship, and the tricorne lander were built. the following compiles the relocation of these outcasts and finnally the return to kerbin of these now 7 kerbals (the new base came already manned).

This is what was made, instead of rescuing the kerbals that were stranded on MÃƒÂ¼n. It was in L.K.O. and it was called midway station.

http://imgur.com/a/CepnT

I recognize she's not good looking, nor as flashy or impressive as the rest of the orbiting beauties in the thread, however, i am still very proud of this one due to the fact that it was all assembled by hand (no mechjeb and vanilla parts). after learning how to, the showoff started. (i was stalking the forum by then too)

The next step after learning was using my own variations of other players creations, here is when i start building for good looking and functionality:
